Description: Box zither; qanun; (a) made of wood with three rows of wooden pegs to which the ?fibre strings are attached over a bridge. Central sound hole. Decorated with inlaid pieces of mother-of-pearl and ebony. Plectrum; pick (b) made of bone, reed and fibre.
Curator's comments: Probably acquired by Henry Christy on his visit to the Eastern Mediterranean in 1850. The slip calls it 'ka'noo'n', and refers to Lane's 'Modern Egyptians', vol.II p.71.
